meanings.definition: A pack or bundle of wind.
meanings.sent1: The strong windpacks blew the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent2: I felt the cold windpacks on my face as I walked outside.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chased after the swirling windpacks in the park.
meanings.sent4: The windpacks carried the kite high up into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The howling windpacks made it difficult to hear anything else.

meanings.definition: To pack or bundle tightly with wind.
meanings.sent1: She used her arms to windpacks the blankets around her for warmth.
meanings.sent2: The storm began to windpacks the clouds together, darkening the sky.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to windpacks the scarves into a rabbit but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to windpacks everything in its path, leaving destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The strong gusts of wind seemed to windpacks the fallen leaves into a whirlwind.
